pull.title: [0.12] Rename permitrbf to mempoolreplacement and provide minimal string-list forward compatibility

events.message:
Rename permitrbf to replacebyfee

"permit" is currently used to configure transaction filtering, whereas replacement is more to do with the memory pool state than the transaction itself.

Accept replacebyfee=opt-in for turning on opt-in RBF

Basic forward-compatibility with more flexible parameters like fss

events.body: @luke-jr What about doing the same like 89d113e02a83617b4e971c160d47551476dacc71?

rename.from: [0.12] Rename permitrbf to replacebyfee and provide minimal string-list forward compatibility
rename.to: [0.12] Rename permitrbf to mempoolreplacement and provide minimal string-list forward compatibility

events.body: I think replacebyfee gives a better description of what this is.

@sandakersmann The idea is that future or derivative versions may support more replacement logic than merely by fee. The original replacement feature was planned to simply go based on sequence number, but that had DoS risks - RBF solves that, but it's not impossible someone may come up with an alternative solution. Anyway, please use #7431 for comments on the change itself - this PR is merely a backport.

issue.title: Some instructions required
issue.body:
First of all, thanks for the wonderful project and sorry for publishing this question in "Issues"-directories. I didnt found bitcoinfibre-mailing list.
 Could you give me some more detailed instructions for installation and configuration? Should I first install Bitcoin ( from this source https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin) and then Bitcoinfibre? Or works Bitcoinfibre independently, after installation from Bitcoinfibre-Source?
That is what i have done.
1. I installed required dependencies and Berkeley 4.8. 
2. Then i cloned Bitcoinfibre from this git-scource.
3. Then 
$ ./autogen.sh
$ ./configure
$ make -j4
$ sudo make install

After that i ran 
$ bitcoind -fecreaddevice=/tmp/async_rx
in order to listen pipe-file "async_rx". But i was not able to establish connection (see below)
![32689479-21b48298-c6e6-11e7-9193-8a162d0155d0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30798903/32800586-05aebe82-c97b-11e7-94c7-f1bb5fc183f0.png)

The same behavior showed program with "-udpport=54321" -argument 
when i ran it in order to listen udp port #54321 
Could you please provide an example from bitcoin.conf that adjusted to fec- or udp-interface? 
What can cause that problem?
Thanks in advance.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,13 +144,13 @@ accepted when it pays sufficient fee, as described in [BIP 125]
 (https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0125.mediawiki).
 
 Transaction replacement can be disabled with a new command line option,
-`-permitrbf=false`.  Transactions signaling replacement under BIP125 will still
comments.body: @sdaftuar Note that "false" and "true" are invalid for boolean options!
